Articles.Content: <figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img src="http://41.media.tumblr.com/d20fbf85ecd92526c094206d1e52bcfa/tumblr_inline_ntato84dGS1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92"/></figure><figure class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full" data-provider="youtube" data-orig-width="540" data-orig-height="304" data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DDjQsyF4xiGE"><iframe width="540" height="304" id="youtube_iframe" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DjQsyF4xiGE?feature=oembed&enablejsapi=1&origin=https://safe.txmblr.com&wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></figure><p>This is the awesome and creative E46 Shattered Kopernicus Part 1! Cinematic #KSP Amazing job from Bob Fitch. </p>

The ending, so tense! this is way better than I was expecting.

Also, First!

Each scene is so well done. Knowing how much time goes into every detail, I kept expecting it to end. Every scene change fade to black made me expect "to be continued". But it just kept rolling along! Honestly, I don't know how Bob can accomplish all this, and keep his day job, and sleep. It's inhuman!

Yeah best video of this series yet! Although I don't get why the ship has a centrifuge habitat and is rotation as well... But I guess it's an homage to "Interstellar".

Here's to Bob Fitch!
And here I read the title and hoped it was a BMW e46 replica.

I expected someone to have overloaded physics, but I got something so much better!

Without video Wednesday, I probably wouldn't know about a lot of this stuff.
Loved this episode, i've been watching them all since gateway. Great work.

Yeah best video of this series yet! Although I don't get why the ship has a centrifuge habitat and is rotation as well... But I guess it's an homage to "Interstellar".

Here's to Bob Fitch!

Maybe what's in the habitat can't stand zero-g.

My hat's off to Bob, he is absolutely great!

way many mods

Bob is telling a story. His mods are modded, so it isn't reproducible by normal humans :-)

So just lean back and enjoy the story, and admire the skill it took to do it.

Bob is telling a story. His mods are modded, so it isn't reproducible by normal humans

Seriously, the guys thought process is a linux command line.
